references.paper_title: Channel augmented joint learning for visible-infrared person re-identification
references.reason: This paper is a state-of-the-art method for visible-infrared person re-identification, serving as a strong baseline for comparison in the current research.

references.paper_title: Unsupervised visible-infrared person re-identification via progressive graph matching and alternate learning
references.reason: This is a key USVI-ReID method that the current work builds upon, using a two-step loop and progressive graph matching; it is directly compared against in the paper.

references.paper_title: Optimal transport for label-efficient visible-infrared person re-identification
references.reason: This semi-supervised VI-ReID paper proposes a novel optimal transport label assignment method and is one of the most advanced methods in this category that the authors compare their work against.

references.paper_title: Momentum contrast for unsupervised visual representation learning
references.reason: This highly influential paper introduces momentum contrast learning, a technique used in the proposed PCLHD method for enhancing the learning process.
This is a foundational paper in the visible-infrared person re-identification domain, providing a benchmark dataset (SYSU-MM01) for evaluation and comparison.
